b"I'm SO peeved at your location at 13131 Nacogdoches Rd, San Antonio, TX 78217. I asked for a route 44 raspberry sweet tea with an extra pump of raspberry and easy ice. They brought me a drink that was packed to the brim with ice. I asked the car hop to please correct it and she didn't even remake my drink, just scooped a little ice off the top and brought it back to me. I had to scoop out just about half of the 44oz cup worth of ice and my tea was so watered down. I go to sonic every day to get a drink for my mother and I and this location is seriously hit or miss. They need to retrain their staff to be friendly and actually caring to what the customer says rather than seeming to get the order and be done with them. It's ridiculous. I wasted my money on this drink that tastes like crap."

b'Hello, my name is Kristi Riddle. I run a small town organization called Phil Campbell Christmas. We originally began our program in 2011 after a devastating EF5 tornado ripped our little Alabama town to pieces, leaving behind devastation and heartache. Six years later, we continue to rebuild and to grow. However, many that live in this town continue to be at poverty line or below and need help with day to day necessities. Many cannot afford Christmas for their children as after paying bills, expenditures for school, clothing, food, and gas, there really isnt much if anything left over to focus on Christmas presents for their children. This is where PCC comes in to try to help. We put children on the list and connect them with sponsors who purchase items for them, very similar to the angel trees done by other organizations. I am posting this message here in the hopes to gain followers who can share our posts, contribute to our cause, or sponsor our angels. Thank you for your time! \n\nWww.facebook.com/PhilCampbellChristmas'

b"I have ALS.  The only food I get is Ensure through a tube in my stomach and a MALT from Sonic.  Shakes are to sweet.  I have been told Sonic is stopping serving malts.  The only food I enjoy.  Please do not stop. I have had malts at other places, but they do not taste near as good as Sonic's.\nI cannot talk.  With ALS your muscles die.  Even throat & tongue I text on my phone & Email.  Please do not stop the one food I enjoy.  I live in a nursing home."
b'Please update your point of sale system to allow leaving a tip when paying by card. I seldom carry cash but would like the ability to leave a tip when I receive good service.'

b'I wanted to give a shout out to the Sonic on 2101 American Boulevard West in Bloomington, MN. They rock! I\'m always greeted with a smile and am given great customer service each time I visit. I have a story about this morning in particular. I\'m 34 weeks pregnant and was feeling very ill, so I stopped for some delicious tater tots to hopefully help me feel better. As I left, a semi-truck made an abrupt turn down the street I was on and almost ran right into me. I slammed on my brakes and the bag of tots dumped all over my dirty floorboard. Deciding not to roll the dice, I had to turn around and place another order. I wasn\'t expecting them to replace the order for free, but they did and made my morning. I was so surprised, I got all teary-eyed. The gentleman\'s name started with a "B" - but i forget what it was... (ha, these hormones) Thank you so, so much for today and every day!'

b"Service at the North Woodlawn store in Wichita today was the WORST ever.  I know lunchtime is busy but this crew needs to get their act together.  It took 20-30 minutes of my lunch hour in the drive-thru.  I waited so long in the drive-thru I honked my horn to get someone's attention (it says to do that on their sign if you need assistance)  After my repeated honking which no one seemed to notice I ended up calling the store and asking them to take my order...I was waiting in the drive-thru.  I was told they were really busy and would get to me as soon as possible.  3 -5 more minutes went by. Finally, a young man stepped out the back door an motioned me to come up to the window.  I pulled up, he apologized and mentioned something about his headset.  He took my order and my money.  I had to wait about another 5 minutes for my food.  I asked if there was mustard in my bag and he ran to get some.  I drove back to work and found I was not given my tater tots....only the corn dog and then mozarella sticks which were for someone else.  I called and a young man apologized.  Too late to go back and get the rest of the lunch I paid for.  I will have to go back after work to get a refund.  That really pisses me off.  After you make a customer wait for so long you should make sure they get what they paid for.  If this has been a walk-in spot they would have comped my meal....but as it is Sonic I have to drive back over there out of my way on my own time to get a few bucks back.  And ya know, they did not give me a receipt....I can picture going back there after work and a new group of folks will be clueless over my refund.  Instead of setting myself up for more disappointment I say Sonic...you suck and you owe me money.  I think YOU should be the one who has to go out of the way to refund me."
b'How does someone go about talking to or emailing someone about an incident that happened today at one of your establishments.'

b'We are so sad with our recent visits to Sonic in Austin, Texas. Three separate visits, three inedible orders. The worst representation of your brand is the location in Oak Hill (7714 W Highway 71
Austin, TX  78736). Over the last thirteen years this location has gone downhill. Really unfortunate. 

Today we tried a different location at 11801 Hwy 290 West - while the service was exponentially better than the Oak Hill location, the food was not good. The chicken strips were luke warm, dry and very tired. The fries were old as well and overly greasy. The "Texas toast" was smushed thin. The onion rings were, however, fantastic! We ordered easy ice in our drinks and they had usual ice. Another chunk of money wasted. We'll come back for the occasional beverages, but won't be eating here again. \xf0\x9f\x98\xb0'

b"Last night around 11pm I brought my daughter to get mozzarella sticks at 559 east main st. Hendersonville, tn 37075. She has had them many times. She bit into a cold solid chunk of cheese. I took a bite and the entire hard piece of cheese came out. We returned to exchange them but they were the exact same way as seen below. So I asked for my money back and the employee jordan came out to my car and said that is how they are suppose to be and refused to return my money. I even pointed to the menu and said this is not the product u advertise. He gave me the owners business card of Bart Cates 615-826-2135 or 615-429-0749 and said, we aren't giving u your money back. I go to sonic at least 3 times a week. They just lost all my business over $5.00. The pic is what they advertise and what they gave me."

Also notice that of this tiny burrito, there is a good amount of empty tortilla toward the end. \xf0\x9f\x91\x8e\xf0\x9f\x8f\xbb"
b'What happened to you all?!?! This is ridiculous'

b"Sonic, thought you'd like to know that your Peoria store just ran away loyal customers over 70 cents...

The grape cream slush we ordered rang up at $4.79, but the menu posted (in both the drive through and at the drive in stalls) said $4.09.
We asked the person working the drive through who went and got his manager.  Manager (Coby) initially refused to acknowledge that there was an issue, until I hopped out and took the attached picture.  He yelled at my husband and told him to either accept the price as it rang up, or move on.  He finally admitted the price on the menu was wrong, but said the computer price was correct and that's what he would be charging.  Ultimately, after asking to speak to his boss, he went off and apparently called someone above him and was 'given permission' to adjust the price.  
I'm pretty sure it's illegal to advertise (on the menu) one price and charge another.   Of course, mistakes happen, and if the manager had apologized and adjusted the price, we would have certainly understood. Really, no big deal. However, his handling of the situation was completely rude and unacceptable.  We won't be back.  All over 70cents."

b'How on earth is it possible to get a grilled cheese ordered, have a delivered less than four minutes later, and the inside of the cheese is not melted nor is the sandwich warm? I would hope that they do not pre-make these and have them sitting around and then just wrap them up and deliver them\xe2\x80\xa6 But that sure is what it seems like happened! This was a disgusting sandwich!'

b"Anyone in De Queen, AR, experienced terrible service at our Sonic lately?
My oldest son wanted a Butterfinger Concrete after his birthday supper last night. Notice the times on the receipt!! Ordered at 7:11, after waiting almost 5 mins after I pushed the call button. At 7:25(2 mins after they reprinted the order ticket), I pushed the call button again to obtain the order status. At 7:28, they finally answered the call, and then they had to locate the finished product, which was on the tray of a carhop across the way who just emerged from the kitchen with several orders. At 7:31, we finally received the concrete, which by then was the consistency of a milkshake.
Which brings me to another problem: they are advertising custard concretes; custard is supposed to be thicker than their normal ice cream. I've had my share of concretes from other places, and, after having eaten one of Sonic's previously and seeing Noah's, they are not using frozen custard. It appears to be just the same ice cream they use in their other desserts, but more expensive. To be fair, the day shift mgr was very helpful and apologetic  and ensured that the night manager would be after I relayed my frustration/displeasure earlier this afternoon. Sonic, these things are WAY overpriced; I can go to the locally owned ice cream shop and get a banana split that will feed 2 adults for less than what I paid for this sorry excuse for a concrete!! 
I will not be giving them any of my money for the next several months!"

b'My favorite thing to order from Sonic is a Route 44 cherry slush float, but it is not on the menu -- imagine, Sonic boasts more than 100,000 drink combinations and I've found the one they cannot fulfill.

At the drive through of my local Sonic in Biloxi today, the order taker actually ran out to my car and asked what I meant by "Float" after I gave him my order.

Like a root beer float with a dollop of ice cream floating in the drink, I said.

"Ok. I just wanted to make sure you didn't want it mixed in like a cream slush."

Nope. I want a float, I said, and he ran back in and came back over the intercom, "What size was that?"

Rt. 44, I said. 

"We can't do that. It won't let me ring it up in the system."

OK, I said. Give me a Rt. 44 cherry slush and a cup of ice cream on the side, and while you're at it dump that cup of ice cream into the slush for me.

"OK. That'll be $5.22."

He did it and it was excellent. Imagine, the Rt. 44 cherry slush float is the best thing Sonic serves and they don't even have it on the menu. Please consider this request to formally add my favorite to the menu so I don't have to feel like a freak to order my favorite thing you make.

Thank you!

Sincerely

-- Scott Hawkins, BTW my personal motto as posted on my Facebook profile is "All roads lead to Sonic."'

b"Was trying to stop by Sonic Drive-In tonight a little before 9pm to get us a few half price shakes.  After getting to the ordering spot we waited in line for almost 10 minutes.  I kept stepping out of the van to see if they were maybe helping other vehicles.  They went down a couple vehicles each time I looked until there was no one in the drive thru except us waiting to give our order. People were also lining up behind us.  After waiting another couple of minutes I thought maybe they couldn't talk to us so we pulled around.  After sitting there for a couple more minutes the girl making shake after shake totally ignored us.  Not once did she clean off anything when she put another shake to be mixed.  After looking a little closer I noticed that the place was trashed.  This is one photo of how bad the shake machine looked.  Disgusting to say the least.  We then looped around and got back in the drive thru.  At that point they must have decided to start taking orders again.  So at this point I am guessing that because they were busy they totally ignore us and a couple of other customers and just left us sitting.  Beyond the fact that this was very bad customer service people should beware because I really cannot imagine this being a sanitary. Not just because of how dirty things like this shake machine are, but because they are handling dairy products and not cleaning anything as they scramble to mix one shake after another."

She insisted this was what I ordered. I have to say, taste like vanilla ice cream with Oreos! Don't waist your $ on a custard!"

b'Wow, Sonic... You\'re based in OK yet you have the insensitivity to use Custer, a genocidal maniac, to promote your custard? This is apparently Drumpf\'s America being "great" again. With 39 tribes in your home state, there won\'t be any backlash, right? \xf0\x9f\x99\x84'

b"Myself and 3 others arrived at the location at 1:30 in the afternoon. We spent roughly 20 minutes waiting in the drive through line with absolutely no explanation for the delay. After things started moving again we had been in line for almost half an hour and we were finally able to place our order while someone who appeared to be the manager interrupted our order with no communication to us and tells someone on the other end that the speaker is working and he then leaves still without mentioning a single thing to us or apologizing for interrupting our order or telling us who he was. We finish our order and pull around to the window and after almost another 10 minutes another employee walks out the side door asking for my payment. We decide to give her my credit card while asking what the delay was. We received no explanation and she walked off with my card. She came back with a receipt for $44.29 and required no signature which seemed odd since other places typically require that for anything over $25. We waited another 20 minutes and got to the window and were asked about what food we ordered. We told them our order and they still gave us the wrong food then asked for the food back and seemed to want to pass it on to whoever ordered it. We asked what the delay was and there still was no apology it explination and just said that we were talking to the GM. We asked what could be done for the inconvenience since we were now late for our plans by 45 min and he said he would speak to the owner and be right back. We waited another 10 min or so and got our food by another employee and were told that we would not get anything as their service was still up to par with what is to be expected and that the GM would not be coming back to speak with us. We checked our order and our shake was melted and our food was all cold and most of it was thrown away as none of us wanted to eat it by that point and my American dog was completely soggy and cold along with everything else. We were all excited to try sonic and now none of us think we ever want to go back as the hour wait in the drive through was horrible and the service was far from welcoming or friendly and the food was cold and soggy by that point. That might be the last time any of us go to a sonic restaurant and I feel like I completely wasted $44.29 on this food for everyone. There was not a single part of this experience that was good, pleasant or enjoyable. The picture I included is the rotten banana we also received in our shake and then 5 days ago I submitted a service ticket and your customer service has not yet reached out to me yet they sent me a feedback form asking how they did with finding a resolution to my issue. I understand part of that was the weekend but to not get any response by now other than an email survey that makes it sound like my issue was resolved is pretty messed up. I can't believe the horrible service I've received from sonic both at the restaurant and from customer service. That was my second time going in 2 years and now my friends and I are unsure we will ever go back... The first time wasn't bad but this time tells me that it's a mistake to go there. Personally, I'd like a complete refund for my meal as well both for the unbelievably horrible food we were given and if course the absolute worst restaurant experience any of us have ever had"

b'You would figure being a company based in Oklahoma, home to 38 federally recognized Indian tribes, and the fact that Custer\'s Winter Campaign in Western Oklahoma was responsible for the massacre of innocent Southern Cheyenne camped at the Washita River, that they would steer clear of this kind of insensitive and ignorant ad campaign. There is a reason why you don\'t see, let\'s say, an Einstein Bros. Bagels ad with Hitler and Himmler for a reason. I can see it now, Hitler is enjoying his bagel and he offhandedly remarks to Himmler, "You know, it\'s hard to find a good bagel in Germany." To which Himmler cattily replies, "And whose fault is that?" They both give a coy look and continue to finish their bagels. You won\'t see that anytime soon in a commercial and there is a good reason for that. This isn\'t a Sonics first stroll down the tasteless and insensitive trail. We all remember this one from 2013 '
link_name: b'Native Americans to Sonic Drive-In: Concrete action needed to eradicate racism'

b'Custer was the perpetrator of the Washita Massacre, who got his just desserts at the Battle of Greasy Grass, known to nahullos as "The Little Bighorn". While he may be easy to satire because was indeed a buffoon and fop... he used "human shields" as a battle tactic, charging Indian camps to take women and children at the start of battles... and killed the peaceful Cheyenne band led by Black Kettle just because they were the first Indians he came across at Washita, never bothering to determine if they were the warriors he had been sent after. They weren\'t. From an Indian perspective he deserves no respect and this commercial, though played for comedy, is highly distasteful. As an American Indian citizen living in the very state that the Washita Massacre happened in, I find it an affront that a county is named for him and unconscionable that one of our great Oklahoma institutions, Sonic, should use him in a commercial. Shame on Sonic. Stop the commercial immediately, tender an apology and help petition the state to change the name of Custer County... Until then, I doubt you\'ll find many Indian patrons at your restaurant.\n\n'
link_name: b"Sonic Drive-In Custard Concretes TV Commercial, 'George Custer'"

b"I've been a Sonic customer for years, but this new commercial is about to make me start a boycott. For an Oklahoma-based corporation, you would think you'd be more considerate of your Native American customers and employees. 

Custer led an attack on Black Kettle's peaceful camp at Washita that was full of women and children. He was a jerk his own men and other generals despised for his arrogant attitude. Despite his promises to Cheyenne people after that attack, he went on to attack Cheyenne women and children again at Little Big Horn. 

He got exactly what he deserved. 

You'd think the people at Sonic Corporate would know that. 

Take this representation out of your commercial line up. It's more than poor taste. It's offensive.

"
link_name: b"Sonic Drive-In Custard Concretes TV Commercial, 'George Custer'"

b"A while back I ordered a grilled cheese at the Sonic in Larned Kansas and it came out on what appeared to be regular bread not Texas toast.  A while later I ordered another one and specifically asked that it be made with Texas toast, it came out looking the exact same.  A week or so later my aunt ordered a toaster sandwich from the same Sonic and it also came out in what appeared to be regular toast.  She emailed the manager and was sent a picture showing that they use Sara Lee Texas Toast and showing a picture of the toasted toast being squished to the thickness of a regular slice of bread.  We thought maybe it was just that Sonic and how they toast the bread.  This morning my husband and I are at the Sonic in Great Bend, KS and he ordered a breakfast toaster sandwich with sausage.  Below are pictures of what is advertised on the menu and what he received.  In short, I don't know what changed, if it's the bread used, the toasting method, what but you are falsely advertising any sandwich made with Texas toast now.  Please tell your managers to go back to the old way of toasting or switch back to the brand of bread previously used.  Whatever the issue fix it because this change is not a good one.  Thank you!"

b"This is absolutely unacceptable and revolting. On my way home today during a 4 hour drive, I made the willing choice to go several travel minutes out of my way to eat at Sonic in Hannibal, MO because I know I will have a quality visit each time I stop. I drove past Hardee's, McDonalds, and KFC to spend my dollars at Sonic. I will provide the receipt in the comments with details of my order and which exact store this happened at. Knowing I had a couple more hours left in my drive, I gladly made the choice to take the time to stop, shut off my truck, order my usual food and beverage choice, and relax for a moment before I began my drive again. I didn't receive bacon on my sandwich as I had requested, but at the moment it didn't bother me as I would have rather eaten the sandwich than spend more time waiting for a replacement. After eating my sandwich, I got back on the road so I could arrive home before dark. However, after I ate my fries, to my utter horror I found this bobby pin in the bottom of the fry container. I have NEVER been more disgusted in my entire life. A customer should NEVER find this kind personal item in their food and there is not an excuse sufficient enough to explain how or why this might have happened. And for me to find this AFTER I have eaten all of my food, figuratively and literally, makes me sick. I had only taken a few sips of my Diet Coke, and none of my coffee; I consequently did not consume any more of either of my drinks. Which was very disappointing as I was thoroughly looking forward to drinking my coffee as I completed my traveling. \n\nAgain, there are no words to describe how truly horrid this is. Whatever cleanliness standards may be in place are clearly not being followed. And as a brand that is known for quality and convenience in the food service industry, this is a despicable piece of evidence which negates everything Sonic stands for."

b'Please remember "I don\'t know" is always the wrong answer when a customer has a question, especially one regarding information that is printed clearly on the menu. If you don\'t know, find someone who does and ask them so that I don\'t have to! My question is this: If the frozen lemonade "includes one flavor add in" like the menu states, then why would I be charged extra for said flavor add-in. I understand flavor add-ins are only 20 cents, but when I read that a large frozen lemonade costs 2.79 AND "includes one flavor add-in" I EXPECT to pay 2.79 for the drink INCLUDING the flavor add in, NOT 2.79 plus 20 cents for the flavor add-in right?! Apparently not, and the manager didn\'t have an explanation aside from "I don\'t know sir, that\'s just how we\'ve always rung it up." But it\'s wrong, and either an entire chain of menus needs to be fixed or the staff needs to be certain of how to properly ring up a drink. Even IF I were wrong in the situation, the way most places would handle it is to honor the menu as advertised and explain the misunderstanding to avoid a repeat scenario. A simple "I don\'t know" isn\'t good enough so I\'ll be waiting for a coupon and/or valid explanation from corporate. In the meantime I guess I\'ll enjoy the two sneaky chocolate chips I found in my frozen lemonade that didn\'t belong there -_-'

b'I am beyond angry right now. Yesterday we bought about 30 worth of drinks for my kids (2 & 4) and my friends kids ranging in age. Spent about $30 not including tip. My youngest got the pinapple and straberry slush but couldn\'t finish it. So naturally this morning I went to finish it off to make some room in the fridge and to my surprise as I was drinking something tasted weird, I thought it was a piece of strawberry or something but when I pulled it out of MY mouth, luckily it wasn\'t my 2 yo mouth, a PIECE OF PLASTIC!!! It looked like cling wrap or something. I was pissed. If this was my 2 yo he could have CHOKED. I called and spoke to the manager and all she said was "well what do you want from me? I said sorry!?!!" She was rude and not even sympathetic towards my concern. VERY DISAPPONTED IN SONICS ATTITUDE TOWARDS THIS INCIDENT. Store location 10101 NE Cookingham Dr KCMO 64157'
b'This is what passes for a Frito chili pie passes for in Seminole, OK'

b"I'm sitting in my car after finishing a supersonic double cheeseburger meal at your location off of Hampden and Tower rd in Auror, Co. Most of the employees here are great, the food was good but before I left I ordered a refill. When the employee came out to take my cup and refill it then he came back and told me that he has to charge me $1.00.
I'm a little suspicious because i examined the entire menu and there is no price for refills written anywhere on the menu.
So, did $1 just get pocketed by an employee? 
And for the record, I did not leave the restaurant between the time I ordered my meal and the time I ordered a refill."

b"This is my view from the drive thru window of my local sonic (350 hwy raytown, mo) pretty gross right? This isn't a one time thing, it always looks like this. Tonight I swung by for a cherry limeade, I waited in the drive thru lane (that you can not get out of one you've joined) and sat behind a car who waited 9.5 min at the order station, NO ONE EVER ANSWERED HER! I could hear her from my car! She left, I pulled up, placed my order and proceeded to the window to pay and pick up my drink. I asked the attendant if there was a manager on duty, he replied yes but that she was in the back and they were really backed up and short staffed (this is a common issue at this location)  I let him know about my wait and the car that drove off ahead of me. . I got no apology for my wait, no let me get my manager, nothing. He handed me my drink, I had to ask for my receipt, and he shut the window. I sat there for 2 more minutes and he never came back to the window. This is the same location i have repeatedly received bad apples from in my kids meals.  Not only was the inside in disgusting condition, but the customer service was horrible. I will be contacting and filing a complaint with my local health department but I thought corporate should definitely know."

b'I\'ve been eating at Sonic for 25+ years and as of lately I have received 3 grilled cheese sandwiches at #4997 that are made on regular sandwich sliced bread instead of Texas Toast. I\'ve been to other locations and talked with other restaurants and they have confirmed the sandwich is still supposed to be a toaster style sandwich. The manager I spoke with on the third time stated this was the thickest sliced bread they have. I referenced a toaster sandwich pictured on the menu and told them in no way was that correct or acceptable. This sounds like fleecing of customers due to regular sandwich sliced bread costing less to purchase than Texas toast. For reference in the picture, the key fob is approximately 1 3/4" at its widest part. - Mike'

b"I would like to advise potential customer's, as well as Sonic Drive In, about a location that is NOT customer friendly.  The location is 9215 W. Parmer Lane in Austin Texas 78717.  On Friday, Oct. 21st., My family and I stopped here for drinks. There were six of us, and it was not a difficult order. Yet the young woman taking the order, continually got it wrong, and she started to become agitated after the third attempt. We waited 21 minutes, while people around us were driving up, ordering, and receiving their orders. We had already paid, and my grandkids were thirsty, so my son went to find out what the problem was. He was met with arrogance and disinterest, even by the manager! There was one young man working that took it upon himself to help us by refunding our money. This was the first and only time we have had trouble at a Sonic, but the worst experience of anywhere that we have gone at any time.\nStay away from this location."

status_message: b"For my birthday today, I went to Sonic to get a burger and a shake. First I tried to order at one of the drive-in stations, waited 10 minutes but no one answered the button request. So, I decided to try the drive thru and the lady on the speaker was EXTREMELY rude then told me to leave!! All I was trying to do was order a shake according to the prices on the menu because I could not see the tiny letters for the sizes, only the prices. Here is what happened at the drive-thru window after the rude employee told me to leave. At mark 0:00:22, you can see the rude employee in the background shooting me the finger! I was not rude to her, I just wanted whatever size shake was $3.19 on the menu but she tried to argue the price was $3.29. I didn't care, I just wanted that size that corresponded to the $3.19 price on the menu (see menu photo's next)."

b'The Sonic on Valley Hi in San Antonio, Texas is The Closest One to Our Neighborhood. Recently the Quality of Service Has Greatly Declined. 
A Recent Example- Last Week on Thursday, We Came to Order 4 Lemonberry Slushes, A Route 44 Sweet Tea, and 2 Corn Dogs. After 20 Minutes of Waiting, an Employee Comes Out to Tell Us That Our Food is Ready,But They Are Brewing "Fresh Tea", So We'd Have to Wait an Additional 15 Minutes. We Were Unable to Wait Any Longer Because We Had to Pick Our Daughter Up From School. So They Told Us They Could Gives Us The Slushes and The Corndogs (which were stone cold by this point) And That We Could Come Back For Our Tea Next Week... They Didn't Offer A Refund and They Did Not Give Us A Receipt. We Went Back Today and Spoke With The Manager, As The Worker Has Instructed Us to Do.
The Manager Was Very Rude, He Said He Would Not Give Us The Promised Tea, and He Told Us, If We Keep Having Problems At That Sonic Then We Shouldn't Come Back.
So Unfortunately, We Have No Choice But To Discontinue Being Patrons of Any Sonic's Drive Inn, As Recommended By Our Local Sonic's Manager.'

status_message:
b'FOOD SERVICE MANAGER Certification Training

January 22, 2016 (Register by January 15)

9 a.m.- 5 p.m.

$150 (Course fee include textbook, practice test, and online exam.) 

OSU-OKC Training and Development Center 
 900 N. Portland Ave. / Oklahoma City, OK 73107
 Office: 405.945.3373 / Fax: 405.945.8616
 Email: tdc@osuokc.edu 

http://www.osuokc.edu/tdc/food.aspx

Operating and managing a food service establishment requires unfailing adherence to food safety principles and practices in all aspects of the operation, from receiving and storage to preparing and serving. This one-day, comprehensive course teaches operators and managers the essential knowledge, derived from accepted industry standards and sound scientific principles, that they need to formulate their own establishment food safety policies and procedures and to teach these to the employees responsible for implementing them. 

On the day of class, the instructor will review all pertinent information with the students to prepare them to take the exam that afternoon. Students should read the textbook and take the practice exam before the class. Students are given two hours to take the exam. The exam is offered online and in a variety of languages. Students who wish to take an exam in any language other than English must notify the Training & Development Representative at the time of enrollment.'

b'Sonic Drive in located at 3806 Atascocita Road in Humble, TX was clearly having a rough day. We all have difficult days, however, I think serving expired/outdated food to customers is cause for some extra training. 

I appreciate the option of a healthy alternative to fries, but these apples were a few days past their "Best By" date. There were multiple people complaining today during my visit with my children, so it could have just been an oversight. 

Not my favorite eatery, but my little one begged to go and I gave in as a reward for good grades...mistake. Fries were cold, soggy, gave me hot dog instead of chicken strips (but corrected this), and the apples looked off in the package so I checked the date and saw this. 

This location may need a little help.'

Please post this Letter to ALL their Facebook Pages!

To all Executives and Upper Management,
 Please know, this letter is to get a policy enacted, it is NOT AN ACCUSATION, as we are certain that the majority of restaurants support the Law Enforcement and Veteran communities. Unfortunately, in recent weeks, we have become aware of Employees and Management of many 'fast food' stores disrespecting Police Officers and Veterans in uniform by writing notes on food packaging and verbally refusing service to Police Officers and Veterans while on duty and in uniform. In addition, your attorneys should brief you on the Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act, which in effect, allows an on-duty officer to open carry in any place that it is not prohibited or restricted on government property. All your employees should be made aware of this law! As Americans, and Veterans, we stand with millions of Americans who see this behavior as unacceptable! We are requesting that all fast food and dine in chains send memos to all store Managers, Employees and Franchise Owners, and adopt a company policy of immediate dismissal of any Employee found to have committed this discrimination or harassment. Our goal, is only to get cooperation, but as we have seen, such incidents can lead to Boycotts and Nationwide outrage. We would like to think that the customers who support your business are ALL important to you. Those who put their lives on the line for our safety and freedom deserve respect from all who live under the veil of their bravery and sacrifice. We are requesting a response to let us know that you have addressed this issue, and that your employees have been informed of your policy, or change in policy...Thank you Sincerely for your cooperation in this matter.
 Your Customers"

b'Last night I went to Sonic with my friends, expecting a lovely night of friendship and shakes topped with the maraschino cherry of listening to our favorite songs. But no. Our evening was rudely greeted by a busy signal and the news that Sonic Radio has stopped taking requests.

Perfect nights were spent calling in our favorite tunes alongside our favorite shakes. Hilary Duff. The Killers. Taylor Swift. More Hilary Duff.

But this was no more.

We\xe2\x80\x99d call in to Sonic Radio, screaming that we got through, waiting like it was Christmas Day for our song to come on, and dancing the night away when the speakers rang true.

But you took our happiest hour and turned it into our wretchedest weekend.

And wretchedest isn\xe2\x80\x99t even a freaking word.

Could you not afford the DJ, Sonic!?!?!?!? Well, I\xe2\x80\x99ll grab a microphone for free, if that means our nation can listen to their favorite music. LET ME DO IT OR JUST DO SOMETHING!

WHAT ARE YOU EVEN THINKING?!?!!?	

I stood by as your menu descended into madness. Raising real fruit add-ins from ten cents to thirty cents? WELL SORRY THAT I ACTUALLY WANT REAL FRUIT INSTEAD OF CANDY IN MY SLUSH! But now I can\xe2\x80\x99t even request \xe2\x80\x9cCandy\xe2\x80\x9d by Aaron Carter.

I\xe2\x80\x99ll gladly let you take all my money, but don\xe2\x80\x99t take all my music.

GIVE ME BACK SONIC RADIO

Still Forever Your\xe2\x80\x99s,
Will Bell

'
link_name: b'Sonic Drive-In: Bring Back Sonic Radio Requests!'

status_message: b'Laying out.'
b'Worst 3.89 I have ever spent.'

b'Dear People of Sonic,

Took 11 minutes for these extremely busy, valued employees to put ice in a cup and fill it up with a cherry limeade. I wonder what could have possibly taken so long. Couldn't have been the fact that they were all jackin around and not paying attention to ANY of the customers, and obviously into some pretty intense conversations on their phones. I could be wrong... Maybe it took so long because they had to go chisel the ice off a block and hand make the lemonade with a homemade cherry syrup. \xf0\x9f\x98\x91 FORTUNATELY..... We live in America, where the portions are too big and cherry limeade comes out of a spout connected to a wall. So naturally, one would anticipate this whole transaction taking less than 5 minutes. But instead, I was ignored when trying to place my order, then made to repeat myself 7 different times because "I would like one route 44 cherry limeade" is SUPER difficult to process and comprehend when in the middle of level 58 in Angry Birds and that conversation with your boyfriend. GET IT TOGETHER SONIC. If this is honestly how you are allowing your employees to behave, I feel sorry for you. 

Signed,
-Angry Cherries'

A man called me back and told me that he looked at the cameras in the store and seen the employees wash the tea container and make fresh tea...so if that's the case than what is this? status_message:
b'Went to Sonic tonight with my boyfriend and ordered 2 molten lava cakes, one was fudge brownie and the other was strawberry banana...and we wait...the entire time we can hear everything the workers inside are saying because they left their speaker on...and we wait...after about 30 minutes we hit the call button and asked them if they got our order...they asked us what our order was and told us NO..then asked us for our order a third time. We decided to go through the drive through...We ordered at the drive through a forth time and pulled to the window and paid....
Again we wait...a few minutes later the kid at the window tells us they dont even have bananas to make part of our order so we requested our money back and told them how long we waited just to be told they had no bananas....so we hear the manager tell the kid to give our money back in all ones...we received ones and quarters back to add insult to injury and were treated like "bad customers"...
Worst service ever and I like eating at Sonic. The manager, whomever was on shift (6/21/2015 @10 PM) is a horrible leader and treats customers like they did something wrong...I wish they had a Facebook page for that specific Sonic, but it is new and there is no way to comment them. That store needs better training and managers that care about their jobs and the integrity of the company. 

2021 Thomas Drive PCB FL 32408'

status_message: b"Me and my boyfriend were running errands on a hot day so we decided to give Sonic desserts a try. We pulled up to the drive thru and ordered two Butterfinger Blasts and an order of onion rings. After waiting in line for 20 minutes, we were worried our food would not be fresh and it wasn't. The onion rings weren't even luke warm and the ice cream was melted. We parked and I walked up to the side door to get new food. The employee was apologetic and went to replace our order. After about five minutes she returned with our food and we left. I opened my lid to my Butterfinger blast and took a couple bites, only to see something blue inside! I dug out a cap to a can of whipped cream! In my replacement Butterfinger Blast! I was horrified that after getting a complaint, someone should be so careless as to leave that in my cup! We did not return, nor did the employee return my receipt that I had given her at the time of my return. You would think with a wait time of 20 minutes, for $13 worth of food, they would consider that when starting a customer's order. One should also think that when replacing someone's food, they would make sure it was perfect! I still have the whipped cream cap and chose not to go back because I didn't see any employees over the age of 20 at the establishment.  I am still in shock that something like that was in my ice cream! (Puyallup, WA)"
b'disgusting! '
link_name: b"Dear Sonic: Please Don't Store Any More Hamburger & Hot Dog Buns Next To The Toilet"

status_message: b'Melissa Kraemer Hymel\n\nMEMORIAL WEEK and the NEW ROADS SONIC treats the American Flag with such DISRESPECT!!! Today at 2:12PM I had placed my order and then noticed this and took a photograph. I then asked to see the manager (supposedly someone named Jeremy). The man walks out with a DUH look on his face, I asked if he was aware of proper American Flag edict and then promptly informed him of the proper way to handle the flag which did not include allowing it to touch the ground! I also said that if his intent was to destroy the flag that I would gladly put it in my own vehicle and make sure it would be destroyed properly. He said "OK". He then proceeded to walk back into the building and leaving the flag as seen in photo. A few minutes later, my food server came to my car with my order at which time I fully notified her that my intent was to return my order if that American Flag was not picked up NOW. She went in, the man came out, he picked it up and tossed it back onto the seat...just not touching the ground...where it dripped. Granted, it was wet, and it needed to dry. BUT it should have been carefully draped over the table and not tossed like a rag!! My father was a Marine, my brother a Marine, my cousin a Marine, my family has members in the Air Force....their coffins have and will be draped in this flag! How dare this establishment conduct themselves in such a manner to disrespect the very flag that protects their freedom to operate in this country. I will NEVER spend another dime at the NEW ROADS SONIC!! Please feel free to share this post.'
b'https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=_yFR14TY60o&feature=youtu.be'

b'It's time for another Car Show hosted by the team at Max Motors in Butler, Missouri! Come join us as we honor service members, first responders and veterans in need. 

Come meet Mark Muller and his team as we put on a car show unlike any other all for charity! We will have peoples choice judging for Best Truck, Best Modern Car 1980- Present, Best Classic Pre-1980, Best Mopar, Best Camaro, Best Corvette, Best Mustang, Best 4x4 and Best Import. We will also have the following awards; Tallest Truck, Loudest Car, Longest Distance Award for the vehicle that travels the furthest to the event and the Max Motors Award for the vehicle that receives more votes than any other vehicle. We will have live music from Band 13 all day long for you all to enjoy!!! We have the team from Meat Street Mafia from Springfield, Missouri that will be providing lunch for all that attend the event. We will be changing things up to make this different then any other car show you have every attended with a tattoo competition!!! We will have several tattoo artists on site and be giving an award for Best Tattoo!

Sponsors: If you would like to be a sponsor for this exciting charity event and would like donate items to go in the goodie bags please contact Nathan Skelton at 660-679-6567 or nathan.skelton@maxmotors.com 

Time: Registration will begin at 8 AM and end at 10 AM Judging will begin at 10 AM and end at 1 PM. Awards will take place at 2 PM.

Location: August 22nd Max Motors Butler Missouri 1108 W. Fort Scott Street Butler, Missouri 64730

Fee: The entry fee will be $10 per vehicle entering the show in which 100% will go to Heroes Among Us. Every Vehicle Entering will receive a Goodie Bag 

Heroes Among Us is a Kansas City, Missouri based Charity Organization that helps with the following: temporary financial, personal and/or professional support and development;emergency needs as in travel expenses for self and/or spouse and/or children and/or family (often times a Hero must travel to Walter Reed or BAMC (Brooke Army Medical Center) for treatments and evaluations. Typically only the Hero\xe2\x80\x99s expenses are paid. Not the spouse or children or family. Even Hero's expenses are paid through an expense reporting system and can create severe temporary hardship); home furnishings that are often too expensive for the Hero and his/her family; short-term educational assistance for children; "Santa Clause" Christmas shopping for the children of the Hero...the Holiday seasons can be a struggle for some families because of financial hardships due to injuries including physical and/or PTSD and/or TBI (Traumatic Brain Injury); special opportunities (Suite tickets to professional ball games or visits with celebrities...if possible or, etc.)

This event is open to all makes and models no matter what it is you are welcome here! Drag Cars, Monster Trucks, Exotics, Imports, Trucks, SUV, Rat Rod, Project Cars, Dune Buggies, Modern Muscle, Classic Cars, Classic Trucks, Military Vehicles we want to see it all!

https://www.facebook.com/events/1646774525553167/

 Thank you,

Nathan Skelton
Car Show King
Max Motors Butler, Missouri
Work: 660-679-6567
Cell: 479-422-4098
www.maxmotors.com
nathan.skelton@maxmotors.com'

b"Last night was the absolute worst I have experienced! The rude way of answering after I pushed the button to place order, the car hop was visibly frustrated. No one put the paid with card ticket with my order so the car hop had to check the card swipe on the menu board. After getting my thawed shake I pushed the button and was never acknowledged so since there is also a drive thru I tried that. The person taking those orders didn't understand the issue so just asked for me to come to window. When I did get to window a young lady barely understood took the drink, handed it to the manager who snatched it from the young lady. A grill person came to look at who was complaining (me). While window still open the manager slammed my runny shake into a trash can and yell to the crew they needed to get their act together. The young lady handed me a new shake which was better. No one apologized, the professionalism was horrible, the service was nonexistent. Location was Mission Kansas I arrived at 8:15PM and it was 9:05PM when I finally pulled away from the drive thru window. Last night just for a simple medium hot fudge shake. If I had not swiped my card to pay I would have left much sooner rather than wait so long for the first shake or should I say chocolate milk. 6665 Martway"

b"Sonic ---- I tried finding an email address for your Customer Service, but that was fruitless.  Let me start by saying that I do like your food, I haven't had any complaints about the food or the service
BUT .............
Notice the email I received at 12:06 AM on Feb 17 informing me that hot dogs would be $1 all day on President's day -- Feb 16.  If the intention of the email was to inform me that I missed the opportunity, I find that insulting.  If the intention was to inform me so I could stop in a get a few hot dogs, the email was literally a day late. 
My email account is Yahoo, so it's not like it took forever to get to some small private email server, or that I didn't get a chance to read it until Feb 17.  The email is tagged by Yahoo as being received at 12:06 AM (EST).
Not what I call banner marketing."
b"*Don't have to be a president to enjoy this deal."

b'I stopped at a Sonic in Montgomery, AL to get some drinks and snacks for my kids.  It was 9:40 AM so the 99 cent drink specials were on and each of us got a large drink. My daughter ordered a Strawberry Limeade (which by the way is not 99 cents cause they charge you extra for the "flavoring").  After we left the Sonic, she opened the lid so she could eat some of the strawberry pieces and she discovered this worm in the top of her drink.  Needless to say she did not drink anymore and was almost to the point of throwing up because she had already drank about half of it.  I called the 866 customer service number on the cup and a lady took my information and told me someone would be calling me from the location we visited.  It's been 3 days and I haven't heard from anyone.  We will not be going back to a Sonic any time soon!!!

Feb. 6 - Update: To those asking which Montgomery location  -  it was the one on Atlanta Hwy across from Frazer UMC.  
Concerning the response from Sonic - as of yet the only response I've had from Sonic is the request on this post for my contact information, which I replied with a private message including my contact phone number. I did receive an acknowledgement to that message that it would be escalated to their team.  Since then I have not heard anything.  No phone call, text or reply.  Not even an "I'm sorry this happened to your daughter" .  To me, it's sad, because I liked Sonic.  We would go several times a week to get a drink or slush during Happy Hour.'
b"You'll be eating a lot of wings on Sunday. Start training your stomach with the Flavor Feast."

The lady in the black jacket I believe is the manager, and you can see the two kids, one little boy and one little girl caught in the act of picking her butt. Nice. Keepin it classy Sonic! b"After being stationed in Maryland without a Sonic anywhere nearby for 3 years, we were super excited to see a Sonic in Tuscaloosa, AL as we were traveling cross country.......until we got our food. I opened up the burrito to find it covered in black chunks throughout the entire thing plus one lonely hard as a rock burnt french fry right in the middle (didn't know burritos came with french fries...guess that was just meant to be another added bonus). No way were we feeding this nasty thing to our Son. Got back to the hotel & my Husband opened up his New York Dog to find it covered in the same exact black chucks. Needless to say it ended up being peanut butter sandwiches for lunch. We've done without Sonic for 3 years & after today's experience, it'll be another 3 years, if ever. #thisishowYOUsonic #thisisnothowWEsonic"

b"Dear Sonic Drive-In, I want to let you know that any future visits to your stores will be to buy drinks only, if that even. On Tuesday, I called your local store to report finding TWO HAIRS in my tightly wrapped breakfast burrito from a Topeka, KS location. They basically just wondered what I wanted done...money back or replacement. I said I wanted to be assured that someone visited with the staff that day to make sure this was addressed for safety and sanity standards for your paying customers. The response while from a nice young female manager simply didn't address the issue. I then called your corporate office to share the incident and the handling of it. I was given a ticket number and told I would be called back in two days. No call came. Apparently, my not being able to eat all day Tuesday due to the fact that I found not ONE, but TWO hairs in my burrito were not a huge issue to you all. I never did go in to get my money back as that seems what you all consider a resolution. Here's my resolution as a once loyal customer, I will buy NO more food at Sonic. Drinks may be safe so I will try that. Thank you for caring and I hope that this will be shared with someone who does care. From a drinks only from now on customer, Kimberly Qualls (http://www.sonicdrivein.com/)   As I read this page, I notice that you don't respond on Facebook either to #customerservicefailure. Too bad you don't care. "

b'Half price milkshake day did not go so well for us today...our first receipt said our total was $6.34...after about 15 minutes and speaking to the young lady at the window and to the "manager", our second receipt total was $5.28...we wasted more gas trying to solve the problem than the problem was still going to cost us.  Even IF we were required to pay the 6% state sales tax on the full amount prior to the discount, our total should have been $5.03, not $5.28.  The real price we should have paid was $4.24 based on the large milkshake price of $3.99 on the Sonic signage outside of the Sonic.  Let\'s even give the benefit of the doubt on the pricing on the outside menu being the problem...our total based on the $3.79 + $.70 should have been $4.76. b"I've never had a bad experience at any Sonic until this one https://www.facebook.com/RiversideSonic?filter=2. Pulled up to the unlit drive-thru menu with a non-functional looking order box (the two-way speaker) and the kid on the other end refused to take my order.

I hear him saying to turn off some beeping, which I thought was to a co-worker... After moments of dead silence I think, 'was that to me' as I look around my car wondering what could be beeping (nothing!). He then comes back on asking me to turn my car off... My car which is as silent as a Prius... If it weren't for all the cops around I'd almost think I was being set up to be robbed.

I then notice some construction vehicle which was murmuring in the distance... I could hear the kid just fine despite the dead looking order box... Nonetheless, I mention the vehicle and there is just silence, so I drove off for a different Sonic location.

Just so unprofessional, and unwelcoming. Had become concerned about the quality of the food I was going to order.  Were it not for my many, many positive experiences at every other Sonic I've been to, this trip would had been my last.  

Please get their District Manager or someone from corporate to look into the integrity of this location. "

b'I went to the sonic in my town last night (Auburn, Nebraska) to get an m&m blast and I literally pull out of sonic and made it to the street, and the bottom of my cup fell out into my lap, with half my ice cream. They didn\'t even give me napkins so I search my car and found some and get it cleaned up and go back in, and you know what the lady tells me? \n"Sorry cup defect, not much I can do about it, it wasn\'t broken when I handed it out. Have a good rest of your night though."\nREALLY?! You don\'t think it could have broke while being mixed and then you handed it out, barely holding together. Did you look at the bottom of the cup? are you SURE it wasn\'t broke in the least bit? Cause you didn\'t even give me a receipt or napkins and I\'m supposed to believe you checked all aspects of the cup? Should I just always expect to eat my ice cream out of my lap when I go to sonic? And where is your customer service?! You couldn\'t just remake it, or give me like a coupon for some free ice cream? In paying for this, I assumed I was also paying for a cup to hold the ice cream, that\'s part of the cost right? Not only the food but the utensils to eat it with too? So are you telling me that in buying your product I\'m taking the chance of it being faulty? What kind of product is that?! I\'ve worked in lots of fast food places, and I know customers complain about lots of tiny, finnicky things, but THIS, was one of the worst food experiences I\'ve had.'

b"Friday afternoon, we stopped at Sonic in St. Cloud, Florida to grab lunch. We had never eaten there before, so we decided to try it. Prior to stopping we stopped at a gas station and my husband bought a few $2 scratch off tickets. Well he won $50 on 1. He and I were joking and playing because I wanted to keep the tricket, so he put it inside the driver side door where I couldn't reach since he was driving lol So after we got our food, he got out of the van real quick and the ticket evidently fell out. We didn't realize until we were well into the next town, that it was gone. Sonic was our last stop, we were sure it was gone but I convinced my husband to call and see if it was found. Guess what? They did find it and had it waiting for us! Not many people would turn it in but our Waitress Cindy did. We drove all the way back to Sonic, to say Thank you to Cindy and we give her that winning ticket to Thank her for her honesty. Thank God for honest people and Thank you to Sonic for having a great Staff!"

status_message:
b'For those that believe protests via FB, email, letter, phone call and boycott will never work against big business yes it does:  Stand strong!!                                                                                    A pro-life leader has won a victory in her efforts to convince soft-drink manufacturer PepsiCo to stop the use of aborted fetal cells in its research for enhancing the flavors of its products. Debi Vinnedge, executive director of Children of God for Life (COGFL), announced that in late April she had received a letter from Paul Boykas, PepsiCo\xe2\x80\x99s vice president for Global Public Policy, confirming that the company will not allow the use of HEK-293 \xe2\x80\x94 a cell line derived from human embryonic kidney \xe2\x80\x94 in its partnership with Senomyx, the company with which it had inked a four-year, $30 million contract for flavor research.

As reported last November by The New American, a PepsiCo shareholder had filed a resolution with the Securities and Exchange Commission in an effort halt the company from contracting with Senomyx, which, according to documents collected by Vinnedge, used cell lines derived from aborted babies in its process of producing artificial flavor enhancers. According to a report by LifeNews.com at the time, Pepsi had \xe2\x80\x9cignored concerns and criticism from dozens of pro-life groups and tens of thousands of pro-life people who voiced their opposition to PepsiCo contracting with biotech company Senomyx even after it was found to be testing their food additives using fetal cells from abortions.\xe2\x80\x9d

But after a nearly year-long campaign led by COGFL that included a nationwide boycott of PepsiCo products, in late April Boykas sent a letter to Vinnedge assuring her that PepsiCo would not \xe2\x80\x9cconduct or fund research \xe2\x80\x94 including research performed by third parties \xe2\x80\x94 that utilizes any human tissue or cell lines derived from embryos or fetuses.\xe2\x80\x9d Boykas also assured Vinnedge that \xe2\x80\x9cSenomyx does not use HEK cells or any other tissues or cell lines derived from human embryos or fetuses for research performed on behalf of PepsiCo.\xe2\x80\x9d

In response to the letter, Vinnedge said that she was \xe2\x80\x9cabsolutely thrilled with PepsiCo\xe2\x80\x99s decision. They have listened to their customers and have made both a wise and profound statement of corporate integrity that deserves the utmost respect, admiration, and support of the public.\xe2\x80\x9d

Vinnedge said that she had spoken personally with Boykas, who told her that in the process of internal discussions on the issue, company officials had recognized that it was not in PepsiCo\xe2\x80\x99s best interest to continue a policy that could hurt customer relations. \xe2\x80\x9cWe took the matter very seriously,\xe2\x80\x9d Vinnedge quoted Boykas as saying. \xe2\x80\x9cWe have an official statement on Responsible Research and we intend to live by that policy.\xe2\x80\x9d

The policy, Vinnedge explained, \xe2\x80\x9cprecludes any research by PepsiCo or third parties they fund from using human tissue or cell lines derived from embryos or fetuses.\xe2\x80\x9d

News of PepsiCo\xe2\x80\x99s decision reverberated through the pro-life community. \xe2\x80\x9cWe are grateful to PepsiCo, and especially to all those who sent a loud and clear message to the management of this company,\xe2\x80\x9d said Brad Mattes of Life Issues Institute, one of the over 30 groups that joined in the efforts to persuade PepsiCo to change its policy. He added that \xe2\x80\x9cthere are moral cell lines Senomyx can and should be using \xe2\x80\x94 not just for PepsiCo research but for all their customers.\xe2\x80\x9d Vinnedge noted that such usable cell lines could easily come from animals, insects, or even non-fetal human cells that express the \xe2\x80\x9cG protein\xe2\x80\x9d relevant for taste receptors.



Vinnedge said that beyond its contract with PepsiCo, Senomyx, which receives royalties for products sold using its ingredients, needs to rethink its use of aborted fetal cells in flavor research. \xe2\x80\x9cIf they do not use aborted fetal cell lines, they offend no one,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cIf they do, they most certainly offend at least half of U.S. consumers who are pro-life.\xe2\x80\x9d She said that \xe2\x80\x9cit only makes financial sense for both Senomyx and their collaborators to avoid a substantial loss of potential market. Senomyx needs to stop using the aborted fetal cell lines entirely and we will continue to pressure them to do so.\xe2\x80\x9d

The pro-life leader added that individuals and families who had boycotted Pepsi products over the issue should now write the company and thank its CEO for the ethical decision \xe2\x80\x94 \xe2\x80\x9cand then go buy your favorite Pepsi products to celebrate!\xe2\x80\x9d Vinnedge said that \xe2\x80\x9ctoo often we seem to focus on the negatives and forget to take the time to let others know we appreciate their efforts. It is our sincere hope that the public will once again rise to the occasion en masse as they did in the boycott \xe2\x80\x94 but this time in appreciation and support of PepsiCo.\xe2\x80\x9d

You can write to thank Pepsi on its website, or by mail to:

Albert P. Carey, CEO, PepsiCo Beverages
 700 Anderson Hill Road
 Purchase, NY 10577

Read more at http://www.realfarmacy.com/pepsico-says-it-will-halt-use-of-aborted-fetal-cells-in-flavor-research/#C45pFKK6BqZdgoB0.99'
link_name: b'PepsiCo Says It Will Halt Use of Aborted Fetal Cells in Flavor Research'

b"Dear Sonic, 

  I have been a fan of yours since I was 6 and my dad worked at one. My very first job was as a carhop in my hometown. I take every chance I can get to stop and get a cherry limeade. This is why it saddens me that I will no longer be going to your Taylor, Tx location, even though it's the closest one to where I work.

I am being literal when I say that every time I go there something goes wrong. I have posted my experiences on Yelp! here: 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/sonic-drive-in-taylor-2#query:Sonic

Today I decided to give the location one more try. I ordered a large chili cheese tot with jalapenos and onion, and of course a Rt 44 cherry limeaid. I paid and drove off, without issue. Once I got on the road and took a sip, I found that my cherry limeade was mostly carbonated cherry syrup, and was very tart, instead of sweet. I went back, and got the same carhop that I complained to last time. I explained that I don't want to be a hassle again, but this time my drink was mostly carbonation.

He said he had to talk to the manager, and returned with a LARGE cherry limeaid, even though I had paid for a Route 44. He apologized and said he forgot to checl before going in, and thought I had a large. I said that even though I paid for a Route 44, I wouldn't make a big deal, since it was happy hour.

That, sadly, ended my long list of unpleasant visits to this location. I love you, Sonic, but if I can't get reliable service from this location at least 3-4/5 times, I will have to unfortunately take my hunger and my wallet elsewhere, at least when I'm in Taylor."

status_message:
b'Hey Sonic, I had a bad experience tonight, and wanted to pass on a comment about it.   First off, it's at your "6202 BROADWAY BLVD. GARLAND, TX 75043" location.

It's in regards to the Chocolate Cream Pie Shake.   My wife and I have been going to this sonic location for a really long time, over a decade.  We've gotten a lot of drinks from there, and my wife's favorite has been the Chocolate Cream Pie Shake.   The last time I was there (a week ago or so), I got one, brought it home, and myu wife started drinking it, and said "this isn't right".  Looked at it, and she was right.   She drank it anyway, because it was home, but she said at the end "I don't know what that was, but it wasn't Choc Cream Pie Shake".  Up until that point, they looked mostly like the one on the link on your website which I have below. 

So tonight I headed over to the same location to get one again.  One of the carhops walked one out to me along with one for myself (plain vanilla).  My wife had reminded me to check it this time before I left, and it's a good thing I did, because it certainly did not look right - AGAIN.  It looked honestly, mostly like the vanilla one i had ordered.  Previous to these last two attempts, the choc cream pie shakes looked like the one in the picture - mostly chocolate.  In fact, this one looked even worse than the last one, because the crumbs on the top were virtually non existent.  

So I told the carhop a shorter version of this story, and even showed her the picture which I had pre-loaded on my iPhone.  She kind of shook her head and said "Well, I can get more chocolate mixed in on the top", and that didn't address the problem of them being made incorrectly.  It's not that it's missing sprinkles on the top, it's not being made right.   I told her, "Well, look at what is in your hand - you can't tell me that looks like the one on your own menu pictures".   She shrugged her shoulders, and said "Well, the store manager is the one making them".  I said "Well, the store manager is not making them right". 

The carhop asked me which one I wanted instead, and told her I didn't want any of them, and drove off.  That's the first time in a decade+ of going to this location that I ever drove off like that. 

The problem is that they USED to make them right.  They haven't for the last two times, and if the store manager truly isn't doing them right, then it's time to find another place for shakes.  Shame, as my wife really liked that item.

I'm posting this so that perhaps some word could be gotten to the people in charge there, and they can make their drinks look the way they're supposed to - and not try and blow them out the door quickly because there's half a dozen cars in line.  Make them right, or don't make them at all.

http://sonicdrivein.com/MenuItem/frozen-zone/real-ice-cream-shakes/chocolate-cream-pie-shake'
link_name: b'Chocolate Cream Pie Shake | SONIC\xc2\xae Drive-In'

b"We watched with sadness as Monday's devastating tornado struck Moore, Okla., just miles from SONIC headquarters.

Since that day, and even on Sunday, following the earlier tornado in Shawnee, SONIC and our franchisee partners have provided hundreds of meals to first responders and relief agencies. We have also coordinated water, ice and sanitizer delivery to the area. 

We are financially supporting Red Cross of Central & Western Oklahoma and United Way of Central Oklahoma's Tornado Relief Fund. We invite you join us in giving to one of these organizations,  the Salvation Army, or organization of your choice. The needs of the community are still not fully known yet and we will remain engaged to help where we can to meet the long term needs of the community."
b'A place to donate'

b"Today, our hearts are heavy with the devastation following today's tornado in Moore, Okla., just miles from our OKC headquarters. We are awaiting news about our colleagues, franchisees and crew members who live and work in Moore."

b"Tourney time is ticking away Sonic fans! After two intense rounds of play with 16 of our top Tots, you've narrowed down the field once again and now we're on the road to the Flavorful Four. At this point we've given up on trying to make predictions. Who is your prediction?"

b"Finally putting to bed the myth that it's the size of the arm that counts, Green T-Rex Tot stomped Farmer Tot out of his domain -- the Ranch Region -- to advance to the Delicious Eight. Carhop Tot, with his slick, albeit greasy style, is clearly the one to beat in this deep-fried, conference tourney run. Carhop Tot favored 5-2\r\n\r\nVisit the Sonic Drive-In page to vote on the other match-ups!"

b'Fresh off Kitty Tot\'s pounce over Clownfish Tot in last round\'s play, it\'s pretty safe to say that it can haz game. But super-charged from his own Sweet Potato Sixteen victory, the big hunk o\' Vegas Tot plans to strip his feline foe\'s chances. Who will rise to the top of the fryer to nab the Spicy Berry championship title? Vegas Tot favored 8-3\r\n\r\nVisit the Sonic Drive-In page to vote on the other match-ups!"'

b'LIKE to vote for Gorilla Tot or COMMENT to vote for Were-Tot.\r\n\r\nThe word ""quit"" clearly not part of his vocabulary (then again, he\'s mostly prone to grunts), Gorilla Tot rewarded his faithful by socking his Sweet Potato Sixteen opponent and reaching the Ketchup Region championship game. Not to be out-fried, Were-Tot rallied for a 47-10 win against the top-ranked Astro-Tot, turning the Big Fry\'s upset factor up a notch. It\'s the Tuberella\'s tomato-potato match of the Delicious Eight! Were-Tot favored 4-1'

b'LIKE to vote for Count-Tot-Ula or COMMENT to vote for Mammoth Tot.\r\n\r\nNot only catching the odds-makers off-guard, but also his highly favored opponent, Count-Tot-Ula validated his BrackeTOTlogy credentials in the Sweet Potato Sixteen. But coming off a triple-digit win himself, Mammoth Tot has the physicality, skill, and salt in his blood to clinch the Smoked Chipotle championship win. Mammoth Tot favored 5-2'

b'Tourney play has only just begun and March is already proving to be a mad mad mad mad month. The final buzzer sounded on The Sweet Potato Sixteen with surprises, upsets, and Tuberella stories across the court. We saw some underspuds skinning clear-cut favorites by posting incredible triple-digit wins. Stay peeled to the action throughout the Delicious Eight and be sure to VOTE for your favorite Tot starting tomorrow.\r\n\r\nAnd, remember, 50c small tots await you at Sonic all day long on 3/21!'

status_message: b"I would just like to say that i was a former employee at Sonic Drive-In in Ellijay, Georgia. I had worked there while i was pregnant && Apparently i am the first woman to work there that has been pregnant since it's re-opening about 3 years ago. I was forced to go off to maternity leave at my 8 month marker by my general manager, not my dr.  Then, when i was cleared to go back to work in December of 2012, i was told that Sonic was under new management and i was not employed under them anymore so i could not come back to work NOR can i get a separation notice to draw unemployment so that i can have some help to raise my son, who is now almost 3 months old. I found another job very recently & I start that very soon, but i would just like to say that store general manager is very discriminant & I m not even sure if im fired or not because i did not receive a separation notice  nor was i clearly told that i was no longer an employee. Thanks."

b"I would like to tell you about my first time visit to Sonic. I ordered the Grilled Cheese BLT.

Number three...the two pieces of bacon weren't done and off to the left part of the sandwich. My first time at Sonic, and I was very, very disappointed. The service took forever to get my 
ONE sandwich to me. I don't really think I will try Sonic again."

b"Corporate should look into the running of their Sonic-Drive in at 2650 North State Highway 360 in Grand Prairie, TX 75050. Something tells me either the cash register machines at Sonic are rigged to rip everyone off - or their employees don't know basic math. Since when does a $10 bill less a order of $8.63 equal only .37 cents in change? What disturbs me is however you look at whose fault it might be, whether a machine error or a human error, this is sad. When I tried to call and re-coupe my missing $1 - I got nothing. Please Sonic, don't let franchises like this bring down your reputation."

b'Yesterday ( Jan. 14, 2012) after my grandson had knee surgery his Uncle stopped at the local Sonic here in Leesville, LA. to get my Grandson his favorite treat "Oreo Sonic Blast".  He told them (Sonic),"Make sure there are no peanuts anywhere close because my nepheu is highly alergic to peanuts".  He then carried the Blast in and gave it to my grandson and said "there ya go, bud, and its free of peanuts! Enjoy!"  My grandson was excited and started eating his Oreo Blast.  On his second bite he spit it out, said "somethings wrong".  His mother looked and there were peanut particles in the ice cream!!!  He had a horrible alergic reaction!!   After all the precaution given to the employees at Sonic to make sure "no peanuts"!!!  After visiting with others, with past experiences of simular things, I think they did it on purpose.  There needs to be some recourse taken against Sonic and the employees at Sonic.   All fast food places have horrible work ethics now days.'

b'Today I learned that you fired Charles Lyons, from the Jacksonville, Arkansas store due to low numbers.  I believe you have made a terrible mistake.  During the Christmas holidays Charles took just a couple of days off and got caught out of town due to the ice/snow storm in our area.  Most businesses in Jacksonville were without electricity for several days.  We own a business next door to Sonic and our numbers are down too.  Not only were without electricity our clients stayed home where they were safe.  Now the Sonic has been down due to a water pipe break.  These were not something Charles could control but had to deal with.

Now I will tell you that many of us will drive clear across town to eat at the Sonic Charles has managed for years rather than go to the one on Main Street.  Why?  Service, service, service.  Charles keeps his staff moving, always on their toes.  No one ever waits more than a couple of minutes for orders.  I pull my hair out waiting at the Main Street Sonic and never go there unless absolutely necessary.  Also my order is always correct, the premises are neat and clean, the staff acts professionally.  For years Charles has built a wonderful clientele for you business, and you will be the "biggest loser" in this deal.
'

b'My partner and I were just accosted by the owner of the SONIC on North Avenue in Grand Junction, CO.   After placing our order and paying for it with a debit card,  Richard Gonzalez, the alleged "owner" of Sonic stepped to the front of my car and yelled thru the windshield, "to never \'f***ing\' speak to my employees like that again".  I am appalled to be treated like this in front of a drive-in of other customers, when, first of all, I never ONCE swore at an employee.  We were called "boy", and told to get off the property.  We both got out of the car, as he walked away because I had already paid.    He refused to give me the number to corporate, he refused to call the cops.  He refused to give me my money back.  I expect legal action.'

b'Was just accosted, threatened with physical harm, and told to leave, after paying for my order in the stall.  the"Owner" Of the Sonic on north avenue In Grand Junction Colorado Richard Gonzalez, came out told me I had better never talk to his Fu%#ing employees like that again and that i had better get off his property. I disagreed with him telling him all I had done was order and pay for my food, and I stuttered slightly, and Richard Gonzalez mocked me and told me "boy you better get off my property  now or you\'ll wish you had". I asked him to call the police, as i dont have a cell phone and he refused threatened me again and said boy you better get off my property and never come back. I asked for my money back and he said we hadn\'t paid, I told him we had on the box, and I wasn\'t leaving until I was given my refund. He went inside and came out with the biggest male employee on staff and threatened us and told us to leave again.  I am speaking to my lawyer, and Will NEVER go to a sonic ever again. '

b"Today I quit Sonic after 3 years, 1 of which as an Assistant Manager. I was treated unfairly and while the rules didn't apply for certain others, they applied to me. I have been cussed at, yelled at, and unappreciated for too long. I have had drinks thrown at me by customers before. However- the most embarrassing thing of all was having my Supervisor tell me that he couldn't work around my second job that I received in order to pay my bills and pay off my school loans because he wasn't bending his schedule for anyone else's in front of all my carhops and cooks. I refuse to ever work or eat at a Sonic again!!!!! "

status_message: b"Went to SONIC at the HWY 5 location and had the worst service ever...the employees didn't care to make our stuff right....the oreo blasts, had oreos sprinkled on the top and none inside it....also the shake never got mixed and was undrinkable as they never blended it...it was thick like the blasts....horrrible We will never go back...good job guys for ruining SONIC for us.."

b'I went to Sonic today. I ordered a #7 with tots and a diet coke. Also ordered mozzarella sticks and chicken bites. I decided to pay with my credit card. When you pay with a credit/debit card, you can't tip on the card. I never ever carry cash... Just so happens today I had $20 in cash. 

The server (yes, they are servers not just "fast food workers") came to the car with a great attitude. She was an older lady and she had a Christmas hat on. She offered me all my condiments, gave me my food, and said, "Thank you for choosing  Sonic and I hope you have a great day." I remembered I had the $20 in cash.. I said, "Ma'am, do you happen to have change." I think she thought I just needed change... I told her she can keep $5 and I need $15 back.
You would have thought I just gave her $1000.. She was so happy and sooo appreciative. Made me feel good to make her day but made feel even better knowing I tipped someone that actually appreciates it and might even need it. Hope everyone can do something nice this holiday season! A lot of people are still struggling... 

Moral of the story.. The sonic lady made my day and I was happy I went there :) '
b'My little one has learned some magic words'

 Why don't you try getting some different managers to run the place. b'We would like to thank those who have served and for those who continue to serve our country. We honor and salute you! Thank you!'

b'Dear Sonic,

I'm just curious...who in their right mind thought that sending a message saying, "Rest in Peace Hunger" was a good idea a day after a natural disaster took place on the east coast? Let's see... during this time millions (including myself) were still without power, people were STARVING, they were still finding children's died bodies lying around the streets of Staten Island, and many were lucky if they had any cell phone service at all to check if their loved ones were okay. Call me sensitive, but having this message be one of the few to actually come through during this tragic time really infuriated me like you can not imagine. Next time, try reading a newspaper and think before you send out an insensitive mass text to all your loyal customers!

Sincerely, 
Alexa Kane, your customer from New Jersey.'

b"Hey Sonic, long time eater, second time poster.

I am disappointed in you Sonic."

b"My truck started acting up unexpectedly 20 miles from home and on a very bad day. Since I was on my way to a Sonic a few blocks away I limped the truck into the parking lot and started calling for roadside assistance. After waiting 2 hours for a tow truck I found I was not physically able to climb into the truck to ride along to the shop. I was exhausted and totally overwhelmed knowing I would have to wait another 45 minutes for a ride from family. I went inside to wait. The manager came to check on me and talked to me while I waited. I can't begin to express how grateful I am for her kindness. There is a angel named Bonnie masquerding as a manager in Irving, Texas. "
