b'I went to Sonic in Ash Flat AR, and for the past four times, they have gotten my order wrong and then charged me extra to fix it.  I have said "tater tots and cheese", one lady thought I said "tater tots with tea" (as in a combo with a drink) I didn\'t get that order fixed, I dealt with it.  But when I went to Sonic the other day, I came home and order was wrong again, I ordered 2 number ones and they charged me for another hamburger (That I didn\'t order) and did not give it to me.  This afternoon, I went and said "strawberry shake" because I know that Sonic lets you "shake up" your combos lol.  and the lady came out with a "strawberry sprite", plus I said "tater tots and cheese" AGAIN and she came out with plain old tater tots, I ordered two chocolate milks and she only came out with one.  We fixed that order and it costed us another $2.49 to fix it.  Then tonight, they FINALLY got the order correct but we\'re all sick from it, literally.  I will NOT be going to Sonic again, no matter how much advertising I see or receive.  '

b"SONIC HWY 92 Woodstock, Ga DENIES SERVICE DOG WATER
Tonight my husband went to the Sonic on Hwy 92 as he was pulling in he saw a man and his service dog sitting on the curb on the edge of the driveway. Eric asked the man if he was ok. He said he was dropped off at the corner of 92 and 575 and was trying to find a bus stop. He had stopped at this Sonic and asked them for some water for his dog. The Sonic workers refused to give the man water for his dog who Eric said was visibly parched. 
The man and his dog are ok now both feed (McDonalds) and taken to a bus stop.
Please share this if you agree that this is unacceptable on Sonic's part. Hopefully if this get around enough nothing like this will ever happen again."

b'To Whom It May Concern:

My name is Jimmy Kay and I am from Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas. I have been heading up a rather large campaign to help find missing Baby Lisa Irwin. On Sept. 29th 2012 at 10:00 am we will be launching a large "flyer party" in Lisa's honor to post her fliers over as much of the area as possible. We will be meeting at a centralized location in the metroplex across the street from Cowboys Stadium and split into groups and post as many fliers as possible. We are expecting about 30 - 40 people to show up (could be more) to help in this endevor. We are hopeful that this will at the very least help raise awareness for Lisa, and hopefully help bring her home. 

Thank you for your time and attention'

b'Dear Sonic, 
I have been employed at two of your stores. Recently, I relocated to a store in GA. At first impression, I was completely appalled at how the employees and customers were/are treated. 
I was injured on the job at your store. 100% not my fault. Another employee caused the injury. I had missed 6 days of work with a doctors note on record. When I came back, my hours were cut by more than half! As expected, I asked my GM why. She had told me, "Because I have been missing a lot of work lately." Keep in mind, my doctors notes are on record. I said to her, I am going to corporate because I believe this is wrong. At that point I am told I am fired and to get out of the store. 
Now, I contacted my director and also your corporate line for employees.
 Why have i not recieved a response?
 Because of this situation, you have lost a dedicated employee and many customers!
 Keep up the good work!'

b'will not be going to sonic any time soon after a petty argument with staff about a coupon I received. This happened at the Houston (Westheimer and Eldridge) location this past week.

I wanted 2 small Blasts, when I explained I had a coupon for buy one get one, they told me "you have to buy a Regular or Large size". I did not want one that size, and told them so and that the coupon did not indicate so. "Our manager said you have to buy at least a Regular size with that coupon". 

This is why I am not going back. Why argue over something as stupid as this? Regardless you are getting money. If you give me a free Regular or Large, you are giving MORE away for free?!?!

The fine print says "*Of equal or lesser value. **Offer requires purchase of a Blast at regular price. Add-ins cost extra. Limit one with coupon. One coupon per visit. Please mention when ordering. Not good in conjunction with combos or any other offers. Offer good only at participating Sonic Drive-ins. Hurry! Offer good through Sept 15, 2012. No Cash Value...'

b'Dear Sonic, I was very offended today when me & my boyfriend went through your drive. We\'re an interracial couple & when we pulled up to the window, the cashier who seemed in a happy mood when taking our order suddenly had a mood change when she saw us. She stared before taking our money. When she closed the window she yelled, "Oh My God, there\'s a nigga girl & a white guy in that car. You take it cause i don\'t wanna look at them!" We got our change & the next girl stared at us too before telling us too pull up & wait for our food. We were so upset that if we hadn\'t paid we would\'ve left. b"I went to my local Sonic's, ordered 4 large coffees, asked for a drink carrier, when I got to the window to pay for and receive my coffees, the cashier handed me at coffee in the drink carrier, and no sooner did I get the carrier past my window, the carrier collapsed, leaving me with 4 large coffees all over myself. The cashier still wanted me to pay, didn't want to replace the coffee, didn't even offer napkins. Sonic's you need to stop cutting corners, hire better employees and bring back the thick cardboard drink carriers. I'm not taking this to court, I will spread the word about your garbage establishment."

b'Sonic, you used to be the best fast food restaurant. What happened? First, you changed the menu and raised the prices. Now you've got the worst service imaginable. 

My family visited the Sonic in Princeton, WV tonight - ordered two #10 chicken strip meals, two chicken strip Wacky Packs, and a #7 meal. Not hard. When the carhop brought our order out, I noticed right away that the kids' drinks are now half the size that they used to be. Then my kids started telling me that they had no toys in their Wacky Pack bags, so I said to the carhop, "The kids didn't get their toys..."

And she replied, "We're out of toys." I asked why the order taker didn't tell us that when we placed the order, and she said, "We've been out for weeks."

After a bit more back-and-forth, she told me that they had been giving out coupons to make up for it but that they'd run out of coupons too. Really?

Has Sonic decided that advertising toys, charging more for the food in a Wacky Pack, and then not delivering the toy or anything to replace it is a-okay? As long as you make your dollar, it doesn't matter if you actually deliver the product?

You can call me "Sonic Customer No More."'

b"Just wanted to comment on my recent trip to Sonic in Clarksville, TN on Dover Crossing: I went with my friend to get an Oreo blast and Oreo shake around 9p-ish. I could barely hear the guy taking my order and I reiterated my order to make sure it was correct and the one who took my order assured me it was correct. I gave my money to the girl at the window and told her to have a nice night but the door was already closed, like I wasn't even there and she didn't give me my receipt. Halfway home, I eat the blast and realize it's not quite right...they made two milkshakes. I called to see if I could get a new one, but the guy rudely said I couldn't because I didnt have a receipt (mind you I never received one). My friend called up there and the same guy answered (the manager as it turns out) to politely complain. They found my order on the log and said I could come back. I got the Sonic blast and the guy asked for my messed up order and told me to take the straw out (didnt even off me a new straw!). I was treated very rudely and I will not go back to this Sonic if they continue to be rude to their customers."

North Gloster Street.

b'Attention Sonic Corporates:

I am writing about a Sonic employee, Eden, who works in Gilmer, TX. Regardless of your faith... You need to read this story:

Today, I was impressed to get out of my desk chair, go buy a Diet Coke (during lunch rush and at the drive-thru no less) and give her a small financial blessing. When I talked with her, she teared up and said that her husband has been without work for three months because of a back injury. They had to cancel his doctor appointment because of money. 

Eden is beyond exceptional when it comes to customer service... and I can assure you I am not easily impressed! She always has a smile, has a "radio voice" that EVERYONE in Gilmer recognizes and is NEVER rude or passes the opportunity to ask others how they are. 

So tonight, a friend of mine text to let me know that she saw Eden walking down the road this afternoon (it was 107 at the hottest today). She stopped to pick her up and took her home. She lives probably about 4-5 miles from home...not sure...

I would like someone from corporate office to call me about Eden... I want to know what Sonic can do to step up and help us in Gilmer, help Eden!!

Debbie Satcher (903) 720-7307... Yes, I am posting my personal number on Facebook because I believe in Eden!!'
b'Pitiful!!!!'

b"We ordered our meal for our family, (1 NY dog combo w/ onion rings$4.19, 1 grilled chicken wrap combo w/ onion rings$6.19, one kids corndog wacky pack$3.19, and 1 rt 44 tea $2.39). We were told our told our total was $17 something. Carhop brought our order, we noticed that we were short the wrap and also did not recieve a toy in our kids meal. The carhop told us that they did not get the wrap. He added it to our bill and our total went up to $21.87. WHAT??? Our total before taxes according to the menu with out entire order adds up to $15.96. This store is robbing it's customers! Now I see why the police department is called out there almost every night. They did refund us our money, of course we never got our wrap or the kids meal toy. We drove our kids over to McDonalds to get the them food. This is the third time I have had to correct them on the billing, they don't ring up meals they ring up everything seperately. This store gives Sonic a bad name and I have no problem advertising that fact."

b"Went to Sonic today, ordered a hamburger, no pricing on menu. Cheeseburger priced at $3.29, slice of cheese priced at $0.50. Being a logical person, I assumed a hamburger would be the price of a MINUS the price of a slice of cheese. WRONG, but at least they didn't charge me extra for not having to add that slice of cheese to my burger. I think next time I'll go to What-a-burger, maybe I won't pay for the cheese I can't eat!"
b"Sonic won't support fire fighters. Don't support those who don't support our heroes."

b"Sonic should be ashamed of themselves!! They do not respect firefighters!!! Sonic gives discounts to police/emts yet, does not give discounts to firefighters! That is wrong! Firefighters, especially VOLUNTEER firefighters put their lives on the line for their community everyday and deserve the same consideration! I know many military/ first responders choose not to use discounts available to them and that is a personal preference. All should be given the opportunity  to decide for themselves and we as a community owe them nothing less! It's about gratitude people! They are not in a service job for the discounts, it's a calling! The very least they deserve is a discount at local businesses they protect!!! Recently, some volunteer firefighters made some dumb comments about Sonic on their FB page. While the comments were uncalled for and probably punishable in some form, they were made out of frustration and probably feeling very slighted. Sonic needs to step it up and show respect to all those that lay their lives on the line daily!"

b'Dear Sonic, please provide discounts to your local fire fighters on duty, like you do for police and the armed forces. Because of your disrespect, firefighters might loose their jobs in Baltimore. \n\nDO the right thing.'
link_name: b'Firefighters disciplined over comments about Sonic'

status_message: b"The manager at Sonic on 710 Fm 1960 Rd E, Houston, TX 77073-1912 need to be fired for her unprofessionalism. I order there today and paid with credit card. Was brought my order and the car hop person was acting strange when asked for my credit card receipt. I was told they threw it away. What!??? threw my credit card receipt away when I just paid for it. You don't throw anyone credit card receipt away. I complain to the manger who had an attitude-very rude because I asked for my credit card receipt. She gave me the wrong number to contact Sonic and when I got home I realized she gave me someone elses credit card receipt. when I called her back she was rude and said the trash had been taken out and hung up on me. Very unprofessional and she needs to be fired. You throw away a Credit Card receipt which you have no business doing, but yet you don't throw away the receipt with order on it. something shady going on. they can reprint the credit card receipt. I still don't understand how are you going to throw away the customer credit card receipt when you are to bring it with the order. I don't believe they threw it away. Just like they gave me someone elses receipt with their credit card info on it, they could have done the same thing to me.  I will never visit that sonic and will not visit any other Sonic until this is resolved. Fired that unprofessional manager."

b'After having a terrible day I wanted to treat myself to a 1/2 price burger and shake. While waiting I left my lights on and my car battery died. What I presume to be the manager came out and advised no one would help me. Tornado sirens came on and a family pulled in to eat and was told they would not be served. The gentleman gave me the jump I needed to start my car but they were trying to get the employees to let us in since the sirens were going off. The manager would not let anyone inside. All employees were outside in the weather. With having my car now started I left and everyone was still trying to get the employees to let them inside. I think this speaks very poorly for the company. I can understand not willing to help when my battery died but to not allow anyone inside when a tornado was said to be on the way is just absurd. I hope this is not a common practice with the company as it will leave a very poor impression on many people.'

b"Went to Sonic (Poplar & Hollywood, Memphis, TN) to get the new Popcorn Chicken tonight about 8:15. Ordered xl Coney, 3 Popcorn Chickens, medium tater tots, sweet tots, & 2 hot fudge sundaes. When told the total, I knew it was too much. Told the order taker the chicken was $1.99 & that it sounded like he was charging the regular price of $2.99 instead. Hard to understand the mumbled speech thru the speaker.

When the order came out, the chicken showed $8.97 for the 3, not $5.97. Told the waitress they had made a mistake & the chicken was the wrong price. She went back in to talk to the manager. She came back & told me she could refund the $22.01 to my card & re-charge it at the correct price, & that I would get my money back in about 5-7 days. Or they could give me another food item worth about $3. I told her that was not acceptable, that they should just give me my $3.28 & let me go. She went back in to talk to the manager. 

Then HE came out & gave me the same options. He said they had policies in place, & he couldn't just give me my money back. other than the way I outlined above. All the while, my food was getting cold & my sundaes were melting. I said I shouldn't have to wait a week for my $22 because of THEIR mistake. He said it was the first day of the promo, & half the staff didn't even know about it yet. (At this point, I thought, but didn't say, that THAT was HIS fault for not training his staff.) 

He finally said he would have to go call HIS manager, & he went back inside. Finally, he came back out & gave me my money. When I got home the chicken was barely warm & was overcooked to the point of being too hard to eat. And the sundaes dripped on my clothes as I was getting out of the car. 

I don't usually have any problem with the food or the service at Sonic, but THIS trip was unbelievable! I hope SOMEBODY trains the staff about what the promos are, & trains the cooks to NOT overcook the food. Based on this visit, I was NOT impressed with this chicken. And I DEFINITELY can't see paying $3.19 for sweet potato tots when the same volume of regular tots costs $1.69 - the sweet tots are overpriced.
"

b'Dear Sonic, my wife and I just drove across the country for Christmas and stopped at a half dozen Sonic\'s for drinks and food. We noticed that you\'ve stopped giving the regular peppermints and have begun handing out cheap imitation mints. Was this a cost-cutting measure, because the new mints are gross. They dissolve in your mouth in seconds and taste like chalk. The well-known Sonic mint is the "cherry on top" of the Sonic experience. We\'ve always looked forward to eating our mints after our food. Now we just throw the mints away. Can this be fixed? I know mints are a tiny detail, but they are a well-known aspect of the Sonic brand. And taking away that "something extra special" hurts your brand in the long run. Thanks!'

b'I too have to send a great big "Thank You" from my heart to Sherri at the Bastrop, TX Sonic for treating Mikey like a prince.  I too am a special needs mom and our kids get little pleasure because of what they have to go through every day and most people just don\'t get it.  For Sherri to not only remember Mikey\'s usual order and have it cooled off for him so he doesn\'t burn him mouth when he eats it is wonderful, but for her to actually get him a christmas present that is appropriate for a special needs child is absolutely amazing and has brought tears to my eyes.  Please please please do something special for Sherri, she really deserves it.  I don\'t know Sherri, I live in California, but there aren\'t that many people that step up and she certainly has, above and beyond if you ask me!  '

b'I know I've posted on here before about the Sonic in Bastrop Tx and how AMAZING Sherri is. She of course said with a tear smile "I'm just doing my job" lol she's humble tooo :) 
wellll she's gone and done it AGAIN! I think she not only deserves a raise but needs one as I'm positive she has to order her clothes special made. I've looked and looked and there is nowhere on earth that sells specialized clothing for hiding an angels wings. I don't know her personally but 1 thing I'm good at is spotting angels and I'm tellin ya She's got some super sized wings in hiding. 
She learned after my last bragging on here that my son has very special needs and just how sick he really is. 
Today we showed for our regular order and she surprised Mikey with a Christmas present. Only a true angel would know EXACTLY what to get for a special needs child. How do know what kind of gift is appropriate for a special child if you don't know that child. SEE I'm tellin ya SHE'S AN ANGEL and we are so blessed and grateful for her. '

b'I lost my (registered) Sonic card at the Sonic in a small town that we go through fairly often. I didn\'t know where I had lost it. The next time we were through there, we stopped at the same Sonic, and I used my new card that I had called and transferred the "lost" balance over to. While I was waiting for it to be scanned and returned to me, I noticed it was taking just a little longer than normal. Turns out that the associate REMEMBERED us by what we order and had saved my lost card, hoping I would return for it. What a nice person. She really made my day!'

b"I'm writing also for little Mikey and his regular visits to the Bastrop TX Sonic, When I heard about the awesomeness of Sherry, a worker there and her kindness and  thoughtfulness to a sweet terminally ill child and his mommy, it had filled my heart with joy. God Bless you  & Thank you Sherry."

b"Writing on behalf of Star Beaver and her adorable son Mikey!! Sherry at the Bastrop TX store needs some bigtime company praise! Mikey has a terminal genetic disorder called Hunters Syndrome. Life with this is hard on everyone. Sherry has Star's order memorized and when she gets there, she not only has Mikey's regular order, but has it cooled off enough so he can get to enjoying his meal! An MPS kiddo doesn't understand the meaning of wait :) Please, someone in your company contact this store and give this amazing woman the praise she deserves!!! xo a fellow mps mommy!"
b"Thanks so much for taking such good care of Mikey in Bastrop Texas. It's the smallest acts the make the biggest difference ;)"

b"For all the SONIC Customers who don't know, A Sonic CarHop is no different than a waiter or waitress in that, in most locations the CarHop is making less than min wage and relies on his or her tips for the night: so she can make at least up to min wage for every hour worked. SO when you show up and order $50 in food and drive off without tipping - Don't think that everything is Okay. "

b'My daughter is employed at the Sonic Drive-In in Albany, GA Westover store. Her breaks and her lunches have been taken away from her completely. I have contacted the area supervisor and have now been banned from my daughters place of employment because I demanded she received her breaks and lunches. Regardless of state law, Federal Law regulates the states that have not updated the labor laws. Federal law transceneds local and state law. Please address this matter. I will continue to make this posts, and spread the word all the way from here in Georgia to California. Thank you.'

status_message: b'I just got off the phone with Sonic.  Is anyone besides me offended by their new, very catchy hot dog jingle where they use the phrase "hot d--- it, that chili\'s the best".  I called and the very nice lady said that they encourage their customers to call and give their opinions, both positive and negative.  FYI, the phone number is 1-866-657-6642 (1-866 OK SONIC) and they are open for comments 24/7.  I love Sonic food but will not be going back as long as they play that song advertising their new hot dogs...they could have said "dog gone it, that chili\'s the best.  Get real, Sonic, please.'

Kyra & Hazebaby"

b'Never going back to Sonic ever. Worked for Sonic for over 3 years in the same store. Then my franchise just decides to call one day and tell us that that same night is our last night of business and that starting the next day we need to clean the store so as to shut it down. I was fortunate to get transferred to another store. Since I\'ve been a manager my carhops at my previous store never came up short. After only working for a total of two weeks at my new store, my carhops have come up short numerous times and I was blamed for it. I didnt change anything concerning my work ethic or routine yet I was "let go" on August 25th because my carhops don\'t trust me and neither do the other managers and accuse me of stealing money. I am truly sorry that I have practically given my life and trust to Sonic and am treated this way. Sonic will no longer get my business, EVER.\n'

status_message: b'I went to the Sonic in Bardstown, Ky and was very unhappy with my service. I came through the drive-thru and ordered the Bacon toaster with no mayo or tomato. I drive all the way home (15 mins from the store) and sit down to eat and I only have a lettuce sandwich. NO BACON!? So I drive another 15 mins back to the store and ask for a manager. The guy said he was a manager and I explained to him my concern. He said well I took your order and I told them to put bacon on it. WHY WOULD YOU ORDER A BACON TOASTER WITH NO BACON?!?! When I ordered I did not say lettuce only. I said no mayo, or tomato. He said he would fix it and brings my another sandwich. For my troubles he added an extra piece of bacon! What is a piece of bacon going to do for my 45 min round trip? So when I got home my tots were cold and my drink was watered down from the ice melting. I love Sonic but this has made me decide to never go back. And I will tell others.'

b'Sonic sucks now. You no longer have popcorn chicken or coconut cream pie shakes! WTF?!?!?! The popcorn chicken has been there for over a decade now and the cream pie shakes have been there for at least 2 years. Thanks for getting rid of everything good. It\'s no longer a freaking "#1 drink stop" either. The drink menu is next to nothing now! I refuse to eat here again until this stuff is back!'
b'Why did you change your cups?? My cream slush melted WAY too fast! Texas heat needs all the help it can get and this change was a bad move :('
b'What happened to the chicken wraps?! I was so disappointed when I saw it was taken off the menu! I actually left without ordering anything. Why are you limiting our options?  Bring it back!\r\n'

b"Left earlier today when they said NO SALADS! I thought it was a local thing, bu sadly, it's part of a new menu. Wow. How many people on your page have to complain before things are changed back? (maybe it's too late, but sad to see a bunch of major changes at once). "

b"What's everyone up to on this hot summer day? Make sure you stop by your local Sonic for Happy Hour from 2-4 pm for half price drinks and slushes! Remember you can pick from a number of flavors to add to any drink.. What drink combo will you try today?"
b'I want gravy back!! :-(((((('
b'hate the new menu\r\n'

b"I just can't understand why you guys would get rid of just about everything I eat there. Hey, lets spend years building a menu and then get rid of most of it for some nasty new burgers that could have been made with what you had already! Call me when you bring the old menu back, otherwise it's been real."
b'Really hate that Sonic quit making the peanut butter fudge milkshake :( But thankfully I found a good recipe online!! Went and bought me a new blender just so I can make my own milkshake!!'

b"Sorry Sonic-- with your recent menu changes and the elimination of the Toaster Burgers, you've lost a regular customer.  I'll stop in once in a while for a happy-hour drink, slush or shake but your food menu is seriously lacking... the burgers can't compare to In-n-Out or Carl's Jr (you eliminated the California Burger a few years ago which was the only one I liked otherwise) and the hot dogs are overpriced and somewhat tasteless...  you used to have burritos and more variety and now concentrating on a burger menu that doesn't compare to 90% of the competition is going to cost you customers."
b'How many negative comments must be made before Sonic realizes it made a menu mistake.  Obviously, they were looking only at cutting costs and not customer satisfaction.  '

b'PLEASE bring back the popcorn chicken.  I have two young daughters who have a life threatening allergy to milk and eggs, popcorn chicken were the only nugget that did not contain either of these as ingredients.  Since there is a sonic at the entrance to my neighborhood, we ate at sonic quite frequently.  PLEASE CONSIDER BRINGING BACK POPCORN CHICKEN!!!!!\r\nPS I called and voiced my opinion  and only got a generic form email in reply!!!'
b'Come Join The Group'

b"Why does Sonic now force carhops to wear long BLACK shorts or BLACK pants in the 100+ degree Texas heat for $3.00/hr?? Fine on the length, but why can't we at least wear KHAKI?? :( I used to absolutely LOVE my job, and happy carhops=happy customers! Unhappy, hot, sweaty carhops=unhappy customers...just sayin'"
b"Did you know that you can call in and request any song to listen to from Sonic Radio while sitting at your local drive-in?  What's the next jam you want to hear?"

b"Several of us noticed that you have dropped some of our snack FAVS from your menu...don't like your new menu at all! b"Sonic Drive -In and customers,
After thinking about it all week, I had to get a Chicago dog. The temptation was overwhelming. I just finished it about 15 minutes ago. It was fabulous! I loved the crunch as I bit into the bun. My mouth was amazed with the different tastes that exploded in my mouth. The peppers gave it heat but was worth the fire. It would not be the same without  the peppers. WOW! 
I am 65 years old and want to know where this dog has been hiding? At last a fast food operation is giving the public something out of the ordinary. Something really different! I'm going to try the New York dog next, but I don't think it can top the Chicago dog. Prove me wrong!
Lisa the Sonic Manager is doing a great job at the Oak Road, Lawrenceville, GA Sonic. Go Lisa"
b"Woohoo, it's Saturday! What's for lunch?"

b"Dear Sonic drive in,\r\nI have eaten at your establishment more in the last few weeks, since you introduced the Chicago dog, then I think I have in my entire lifetime. There are 2 things that I wish to discuss with you. the first one is- how do you expect me to lose weight while you are offerining what I think is the best hot dog EVER!  I'm wondering if I can sue you for trying to sabotage my weight loss efforts. Secondly, I know for a fact that you have received LOTS of business since I ate my first Chicago dog, not only by me, but by the many, many Coastians that have tried it on my recommendation. I am willing to settle with you for the weight loss sabotage if you will just offer me free hot dogs. I am not looking for a lifetime commitment of free hot dogs but maybe 6 months worth. I think that it is the least you can do for the advertisement I have been doing for you and it would save you a lot of money.\r\n"

b"The New York Dog - Get a taste of the Big Apple with SONIC's Premium Beef New York Dog. A 100% pure beef hot dog grilled to perfection and topped with spicy brown mustard, grilled onions and crunchy sauerkraut in a soft, warm bakery bun."

b"The All-American Dog - Take a bite out of Americana with SONIC's Premium Beef All-American Dog. It's a 100% pure beef hot dog that's grilled to perfection and topped with ketchup, yellow mustard, relish and chopped onions and served in a soft, warm bakery bun."

b"The Chili Cheese Coney - Want something filling that's also a great deal? Try SONIC's Premium Beef Chili Cheese Coney. It's a grilled 100% pure beef hot dog topped with warm chili and melty cheddar cheese served in a soft, warm bakery bun."

b"The Chicago Dog - Got love for the Windy City? Then try SONIC's Premium Beef Chicago Dog. A 100% pure beef hot dog topped with pickle, relish, tomato, sport peppers, celery salt and mustard all served up in a soft, warm poppy seed bun."

b"I carhop everyday and I love it. It's fun being out with all the people and it's amazing the relationships you build with some of your customers. I am on a first name basis with all of my regulars as is most of our crew! Friendly faces and good family oriented personality gets you a long way! \n"

b"This is Jackie Ramsey from Simpsonville SC sonic. I want everyone to know what type of boss I have.I have been withSonic almost 2 years. I work hard and try to get along with all.Ronnie and Dustin Riddle have seen me work and heard my mouth. But my manager Chris Meadows has always been a good boss. But now he has gone even further. I don't miss time from work but 2 weeks ago tomorrow I carried my husband to the hospital er for severe headaches. We found out 3 hours later he has brain cancer. After being in the hospital for 4 days we find he has brain, lung, and lymph node cancer. the drs. say it will be a miracle if he makes it 3 months. Now granted Hospice has helped.  But my boss has taken it upon himself and the whole crew has helped to have a fund raiser for us. I just want everyone to know how special the Simpsonville SC Sonic is and its employees. Thanx again for your prayers and your donations. Jackie Ramsey 49 Dove Lane Fountain Inn SC 29644"
b'$2.99 BLT & Tots. Need we say more?'

b'Hello! My name is Emily I've been a carhop at my wonderful Sonic location for almost a year. I was just wondering if any other carhops could share how they answer the speaker. I have the plain ol, "thank you for choosing Sonic, my name is Emily! How may I help you!" But I switched it up a bit and have been saying "welcome to the wonderful world of sonic where we make all your fast food dreams come true! My name is Emily, how may I help you!" 
I enjoy interacting w the guest in a way that makes them enjoy their time on our property a little bit more, and come back over and over again!

So.....that being said does anyone have any opening lines intros that I could use for my sonic career enjoyment? 

Thank you!
Have a great weekend!! 
(^-^)'

b'Dear Sonic,
In 2003, my new friend and owner trusted me to protect his camera everywhere it went; I kept it safe and sound through countless adventures. Over the years I became more than just the camera keeper; I became his friend and constant companion. I was even there when he met the love of his life, whom he would go on to marry. His wife embraced me with open arms. They took me on their romantic getaways to places like Mexico, The Domincan Republic, New York, Fiji, Chicago, the list goes on and on. However, I was most honored when they asked me to be the ring bearer in their wedding this past spring. It was an honor that may never be topped. Sadly however, I have been seperated from them... our last and possibly final adventure together was to Austin City Limits Music Festival, where I was kidnapped. While I may never be reunited with my owners, the void my absence leaves behind needs to be filled. Can you please find them a replacement?
With hope,
Tot'

Different stores in one are doing different things.  like using lime juice or the lemonade in their drinks along with or instead of the real fruit, as they are called Real Fruit drinks and slushes. I dunno, i'm just wondering what everyone else's stores do as far as basic funcitons and stuff.  Cause it's confusing, and the GM wants me to help 'clean house' and bring business back."

b"We just returned from the Sonic on 167th Street in Country Club Hills, Illinois, store #5925. The food was good. However, we ordered Bacon Cheeseburgers with lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo-menu board price: $3.79. Our price: $3.90. We were charged $3.20 for a cheeseburger with $.70 added for the bacon. Next, we were charged $.10 for chocolate in the milkshake. Uhmmm...the menu board listed the milkshakes cost as $2.59. There was no mention of an extra $.10 for the chocolate in the milkshake area.  Drink add-ins are at the bottom of the board with a clear arrow pointing to the soft drinks. The milkshakes are at the top of the board with all flavors listed. I do have pictures of the menu board and my receipt. I would love to send them to Sonic if they would provide an email. That is a blatant rip-off. Needless to say, I will most likely NOT drive the 10 miles from Chicago to go there anymore. I can go to McDonald's or Burger King."

b'In Memoriam:  Troy Smith, Sr., Founder of Sonic Drive-In '

b'Sonic honors and mourns the passing of Troy Smith, Sr., the founder of Sonic Drive-In.  It was in 1953 in Shawnee, Okla. that Troy operated a root beer stand called The Top Hat, which eventually became Sonic Drive-In.  Troy\xe2\x80\x99s legacy remains alive today because of the relationships with Sonic\xe2\x80\x99s great customers and operators that have been built over the years.  Troy\xe2\x80\x99s remarkable entrepreneurial spirit, his pragmatic, no nonsense approach to the business, and his desire to create opportunities for others, earned him many friends and admirers over his lifetime.  He will be remembered for his generosity and gentle nature.'

b"Man I hope your Sonic store at I-240 & Sooner Rd isn't a corporate store.\nOrdered a toasted chicken sandwich from there tonight & the bread was not toasted.\nIt was on white bread. Called again and they put it off the hook.  Unbeknown to them we sat & listened to them talk & work.   Not a good way to run a Sonic store guys.  Not good.  We're calling corporate on Wednesday. b'I live in Ecuador, South America, and right here all the fast food we have is McDonald\'s, and a couple of BKs somewhere, and I thought it was good enough. In May, on a trip to Texas, I had the opportunity to savor with my craving tongue the taste of a Sonic Cheeseburger with Sonic onion rings, and for the love of all the angels in Heaven... IT-WAS-GOOD! Or as they say, Sonic good! And I finished it with a regular Sonic Blast Oreo... I bought regular because I didn\'t know if I would like it, and let me tell you, even though the Large one would have been much better, I made no mistake, as the Regular one was large enough, not like at other fast food places where you ask for something "Regular-sized" and they have to give it to you with a dropper! I keep the ticket as a souvenir along with all the memories of that felicitous day when I discovered what "sins of the flesh" really means... but it isn\'t enough! it has been almost 2 months and I need that flavor again! SONIC GO INTERNATIONAL!'
